title: VA Health Care
summary: Eligible Veterans may enroll in VA health care services, including primary care, specialty care, mental health care, and prescriptions.

requirements.notes: Eligibility depends on service history, discharge status, income, and other factors. Disability rating may affect priority group and copays.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility depends on service history, discharge status, income, and other factors. Disability rating may affect priority group and copays.

title: VA Disability Compensation
summary: Monthly tax-free payments for Veterans with service-connected disabilities.

requirements.notes: Requires a service-connected condition and a VA disability rating.

eligibilityNotes: Generally requires a service-connected disability. The VA assigns a disability rating based on medical evidence.

title: VA Home Loan Guaranty
summary: VA-backed home loans that may offer no down payment, limited closing costs, and competitive interest rates.

requirements.notes: Eligibility depends on service requirements and obtaining a Certificate of Eligibility (COE). Disability status may impact funding-fee exemption.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility depends on service requirements and a VA Certificate of Eligibility (COE). Some Veterans with service-connected disabilities may qualify for a funding fee waiver.

title: Specially Adapted Housing (SAH) Grant
summary: Grant up to $126,526 (FY 2026) to help severely disabled veterans build, buy, or modify a home to accommodate their disability.

requirements.notes: Requires loss of use of both lower extremities, blindness in both eyes, loss/loss of use of one lower extremity with residual effects, or other qualifying conditions.

eligibilityNotes: Can be used up to 6 times over lifetime. Qualifying conditions include: loss or loss of use of both legs, blindness in both eyes (20/200 or less), loss of use of one leg with residual effects, or loss of use of one lower extremity after 9/11 that prevents balance/walking without assistance.

title: Special Housing Adaptation (SHA) Grant
summary: Grant up to $23,000 (approximate, adjusted annually) to help disabled veterans adapt or purchase a home to accommodate their disability.

requirements.notes: Requires blindness in both eyes with 5/200 visual acuity or less, loss/loss of use of both hands, or certain respiratory conditions.

eligibilityNotes: Can be used multiple times up to maximum amount. For veterans with less severe disabilities than SAH requirements. Can adapt existing home or help purchase adapted home.

title: Temporary Residence Adaptation (TRA) Grant
summary: Grant to help SAH/SHA-eligible veterans adapt a family member's home where they are temporarily residing.

requirements.notes: Must be eligible for SAH or SHA grant and temporarily residing in a family member's home.

eligibilityNotes: Maximum amounts vary based on SAH vs SHA eligibility. For veterans temporarily living with family members. Family member must own the home.

title: Home Improvements and Structural Alterations (HISA) Grant
summary: Grant up to $6,800 for service-connected disabled veterans or $2,000 for non-service-connected to make home modifications necessary for medical treatment or disability access.

requirements.notes: Up to $6,800 for veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability. $2,000 for veterans with non-service-connected conditions under certain criteria.

eligibilityNotes: Lifetime benefit maximum. Must be enrolled in VA healthcare and receive prescription from VA healthcare provider. Administered through local VA medical center prosthetics department.

title: Automobile Allowance
summary: One-time payment of $27,075 (FY 2026) to help purchase a specially equipped vehicle for veterans with certain service-connected disabilities.

requirements.notes: Requires loss or permanent loss of use of one or both feet/hands, permanent decreased vision in both eyes, or ankylosis of one or both knees/hips.

eligibilityNotes: VA pays seller directly. Can be awarded once every 30 years, or sooner if vehicle destroyed by natural disaster. Must apply before purchasing vehicle. Includes cars, vans, motor homes, trucks, tractors.

title: Adaptive Equipment for Vehicles
summary: Multiple grants available to modify vehicles with adaptive equipment like power steering, lifts, hand controls, or other specialized equipment.

requirements.notes: Available to veterans who meet automobile allowance criteria or have ankylosis in knees/hips. Can be renewed for repairs/replacements.

eligibilityNotes: Unlike automobile allowance, adaptive equipment grants can be issued multiple times for repairs, replacements, or new equipment. Prescribed by VHA physician or Certified Driver Rehabilitation Specialist.

title: Annual Clothing Allowance
summary: Annual payment of $1,053 (2026) to replace clothing damaged by prosthetic/orthopedic devices or skin medications for service-connected conditions.

requirements.notes: Prosthetic/orthopedic device must damage clothing, or skin medication must irreparably stain outer garments.

eligibilityNotes: Can receive multiple allowances (up to 4 per year) if multiple devices/medications damage different types of clothing. Apply by August 1st annually. Recurring payment - no need to reapply after initial approval.

title: CHAMPVA Health Insurance
summary: Comprehensive health insurance for spouses, dependents, and survivors of veterans with permanent and total service-connected disabilities or who died from service-connected conditions.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be rated permanently and totally disabled, OR veteran died from service-connected disability, OR veteran died while rated P&T. Not eligible if qualify for TRICARE.

eligibilityNotes: Covers spouses, dependent children, and primary family caregivers. Cost-sharing program - CHAMPVA pays 75% after $50 individual/$100 family deductible. $3,000 annual catastrophic cap. Surviving spouses lose benefits if remarry before age 55.

title: Veterans Preference in Federal Hiring
summary: Preference points awarded to veterans in competitive federal hiring and priority during reductions in force.

requirements.notes: 5-point preference for honorably discharged veterans who served during wartime or certain periods. 10-point preference for service-connected disabled veterans.

eligibilityNotes: Does not guarantee employment but provides competitive advantage. Disabled veterans with 10%+ rating placed at top of category on referral lists at VA. Does not apply to promotions or transfers.

title: Veterans Recruitment Appointment (VRA)
summary: Non-competitive hiring authority allowing eligible veterans to be appointed to federal positions up to GS-11 without competition.

requirements.notes: Available to disabled veterans, veterans who served during war/campaign, or veterans who separated within 3 years.

eligibilityNotes: After 2 years of successful performance, veterans are converted to career or career-conditional appointment. No grade level limitations. Faster path to federal employment.

title: 30% or More Disabled Veterans Hiring Authority
summary: Non-competitive hiring authority for veterans with 30%+ service-connected disability to any federal position at any grade level.

requirements.notes: Must have 30% or higher service-connected disability rating from VA.

eligibilityNotes: No grade level restrictions. Can be converted to career appointment based on successful performance. Provides fastest path to federal employment for 30%+ disabled veterans.

title: America the Beautiful Access Pass (National Parks)
summary: Free lifetime pass providing access to 2,000+ federal recreation sites including national parks, wildlife refuges, and forests for disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Must have permanent service-connected disability that severely limits one or more major life activities. Any percentage rating qualifies.

eligibilityNotes: Admits passholder plus 3 additional adults where per-person fees charged, or entire vehicle at per-vehicle sites. Provides 50% discount on some amenity fees like camping. Free if obtained in person, $10 processing fee if ordered online.

title: America the Beautiful Military Lifetime Pass
summary: Free lifetime pass to 2,000+ federal recreation sites for all U.S. military veterans and Gold Star Families.

requirements.notes: Available to all U.S. military veterans (any era) and Gold Star Families.

eligibilityNotes: Covers entrance and standard amenity fees at national parks, wildlife refuges, forests, and BLM lands. Does not cover camping, tours, or concessions. Free in person or $10 processing fee online.

title: Commissary and Military Exchange Shopping Privileges
summary: In-store shopping access at military commissaries and exchanges for veterans with service-connected disabilities, providing significant savings on groceries and retail items.

requirements.notes: Any service-connected disability rating qualifies. Purple Heart recipients and former POWs also eligible.

eligibilityNotes: Use Veteran Health ID Card (VHIC) or VA letter with government ID for access. 1.43% surcharge on credit card purchases. Commissary saves approximately 25% vs commercial stores. 100% disabled veterans can obtain DoD ID card for easier access.

title: SBA Veteran Small Business Certification (VOSB/SDVOSB)
summary: Federal certification enabling veteran-owned businesses to compete for set-aside and sole-source government contracts.

requirements.notes: Business must be 51%+ veteran-owned and controlled. SDVOSB requires service-connected disability.

eligibilityNotes: VOSB: Access to VA sole-source/set-aside contracts (7% of VA contracts). SDVOSB: Access to federal sole-source/set-aside contracts (5% of all federal contracts). Free certification through SBA.

title: Veterans Business Outreach Centers (VBOCs)
summary: 31 nationwide centers providing free business training, counseling, mentorship, and resources to veteran entrepreneurs.

requirements.notes: Available to veterans, service members, National Guard/Reserve, and military spouses.

eligibilityNotes: Free services include business plan development, workshops, concept assessments, mentorship, and connections to lenders and SBA programs. Conducts Boots to Business programs.

title: GI Bill Education Benefits
summary: Education benefits to help Veterans, service members, and dependents pay for school or training.

requirements.notes: Eligibility varies by GI Bill program and depends on service history and discharge status.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility depends on service history and discharge status. Multiple GI Bill programs exist (e.g., Post-9/11 GI Bill, Montgomery GI Bill).

title: Veteran Readiness and Employment (VR&E)
summary: Employment, training, and education support for Veterans with service-connected disabilities and certain dependents.

requirements.notes: VR&E eligibility generally depends on having a service-connected disability rating and meeting program criteria; see official VA guidance.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility depends on service-connected disability status and other factors. See VA guidance for details and how to apply.

title: VA Life Insurance
summary: Life insurance programs for Veterans, including options for those with service-connected disabilities.

requirements.notes: Programs vary based on service status, disability status, and application timing. See VA program pages for details.

eligibilityNotes: Programs vary based on service status, disability status, and application timing. See VA program pages for details.

title: VA Burial and Memorial Benefits (Overview)
summary: Overview of VA burial and memorial benefits, including national cemetery burial, headstones/markers, and related support.

requirements.notes: Eligibility depends on service and discharge status; see linked pages for program-specific requirements.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility depends on service history and discharge status. See linked pages for specific programs and requirements.

title: Burial in a VA National Cemetery (Eligibility)
summary: Eligibility information for burial in a VA national cemetery for Veterans and eligible family members.

requirements.notes: Eligibility varies by status and service history. A pre-need eligibility determination may be available.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility varies by status and service history. A pre-need eligibility determination may be available.

title: Veterans Burial Allowance
summary: Financial assistance to help cover some burial and funeral costs for eligible Veterans.

requirements.notes: Amounts/eligibility vary based on circumstances of death and burial; see VA guidance for requirements and how to apply.

eligibilityNotes: Eligibility and amounts vary based on circumstances. See VA guidance for requirements and how to apply.

title: Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC)
summary: Monthly tax-free benefit paid to eligible surviving spouses, children, or parents of service members who died in the line of duty or from a service-connected condition.

requirements.notes: Service member must have died from service-connected condition or in line of duty.

eligibilityNotes: For surviving spouses, children, or parents. Surviving spouses must not have remarried (or remarried after age 57).

title: Aid and Attendance / Housebound Benefits
summary: Additional monthly payments for veterans or survivors who need help with daily activities or are largely confined to their home.

requirements.notes: Requires medical need and qualifying pension or survivor benefit.

eligibilityNotes: Must qualify for VA pension and require regular aid and attendance of another person, or be housebound.

title: VA State Veterans Homes (Federal Program)
summary: VA-supported long-term care facilities operated by states for eligible veterans.

requirements.notes: Eligibility depends on VA status, clinical need, and state-specific admission rules.

eligibilityNotes: Each state sets own admission criteria. VA provides per diem payments to states. 175 homes across all 50 states.
